none: A group of people gather around a long dining table.

body.creator: Olivia Flores
body.value: Barry's parents are conspicuously absent from the film. PTA addressed this fact during an audience Q&A: "I never really made up my mind about the parents. It just seemed to not have a place. It would seem like another movie, even to include them in the party scene. Yeah, it just seemed like another movie. I wasnâ€™t really sure if they were around or they died or they passed away. Then you gotta cast parents and you have to think about the dynamic between the sisters, when all I wanted to do was seven sisters and him" ("Interview: BAM Q&A").

body.creator: Olivia Flores
body.value: This odd, green, textured block of wall stands out dramatically amid the rest of the largely mundane, subdued color scheme of the house. It precedes the green of the 7UP display at the grocery store and the green wall in the hospital's emergency room. The choice of green is a canny use of color theory. Within one model of color theory, the primary colors are red, blue, and yellow. Combinations of these colors produce the secondary colors: orange (red and yellow), purple (blue and red), and green (blue and yellow). Green is the only secondary color that does not contain red. Indeed, because red and green are opposite each other on the color wheel, they are considered complementary, providing the strongest perceptual contrast against each other. In the context of Punch-Drunk Love, green acts as the most oppositional color to Lena's red.

body.creator: Olivia Flores
body.value: An evocation of The Last Supper. PTA stages a similar dinner scene in Inherent Vice when Doc tracks down Coy Harlingen.
